postsData.name:
Mahmoud Owies
Mahmoud Owies
postsData.content:
You like winter...But you hate being unable to warm your feet. 

You like summer...But you hate being so sweaty that you feel like melting in hell.

You like spring...But allergies!

You like autumn...but it's always sad and stressful.

Also, Are spring and autumn still a thing?

Nothing is perfect...

There's always a flaw to be found...

It was never about finding the perfect thing...

The perfect job...

The perfect person...

The perfect situation...

The perfect moment...

Or the perfect life...

It was always about finding things that you could live with, flaws and all...

Learning to appreciate their flaws...Or even love them.

So, Instead of wasting our lives looking for perfection, let's start accepting flaws.
Ours.
Theirs.

Let's appreciate life more...And let go of extremes...

Flaws are not the enemy...they're a wonderful part of the story...and it's time to embrace them.

comments.commentText:
All humans...
But not me, right?

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Embracing imperfections not only enriches our experiences but also fosters genuine connections. Let’s celebrate the beautiful messiness of life!

postsData.name:
Luigi LENGUITO
Luigi LENGUITO
postsData.content:
Today 
hashtag
#CyberTalent spotlight is on Alessandra Venneri

What was your original career path and how did you end up in the cyber security field?

After my degree in Science of Communication at La Sapienza and a Master’s in Corporate Communications and Digital Marketing, I started my career at Emotion company, one of the most innovative distributors in IT in Italy. After 2 years, I joined Kaspersky as PR and Marketing Manager. I quickly advanced within the company, becoming responsible for Communications and Public Affairs for Italy and South East Europe.

ℹ️ What is the most appealing thing to you about working in cyber security?

As my mission is to create a safer future, I’m not only concerned about the well-being of the world in a digital capacity. Gender equality, accessible knowledge, volunteering, paying attention to children, animal protection and other similar issues are really important to me. Kaspersky creates many social projects aimed at changing the everyday lives of people for the better.

 Name a book/movie that has inspired you. Anything specific to cyber security that you would recommend?

Virginia Woolf, “A Room of One’s Own”.


 I recommend you to follow her , like and comment on this post to share her example, and perhaps suggest others to showcase !

>>> This profile is part of a series I’m publishing every other day in collaboration with @Women4Cyber Foundation, follow me to receive the next updates.
postsData.commentAdded: Inspiring journey, Alessandra! Your commitment to making a difference in cyber security and beyond is truly commendable. #WomenInCyber

postsData.name:
Ford Coleman
Ford Coleman
postsData.content:
Stop looking at resumes.

Start looking for potential.

The past doesn't predict how far someone can go.

Here are 6 things that matter more than experience:

1️⃣ Raw Drive
↳ Look for hunger to succeed.
↳ Find people who push themselves daily.

2️⃣ Quick Learning
↳ Spot those who grab new skills fast.
↳ Value curiosity over certainty.

3️⃣ Growth Mindset
↳ Seek people who love challenges.
↳ Find those who learn from mistakes.

4️⃣ Fresh Ideas
↳ Look for different ways of thinking.
↳ Find people who question "normal."

5️⃣ Team Spirit
↳ Spot those who lift others up.
↳ Value players who share wins.

6️⃣ Clear Vision
↳ Find people who see the big picture.
↳ Look for long-term thinkers.

Skills can be taught.
Drive can't.

Hire for tomorrow, not yesterday.

What quality matters most when you're hiring?
Let me know in the comments below ⬇

 Repost if you found this insightful!
 Followfor more!

postsData.name:
The AI Space Podcast with Host Sanjay Kalluvilayil
The AI Space Podcast with Host Sanjay Kalluvilayil
postsData.content:
What’s shaping the AI landscape in 2025? On The AI Space Podcast, Brad Messer (Structure AI) shares his predictions with host Sanjay Kalluvilayil, highlighting the rise of AI agents and specialized AI models. These aren’t just theoretical concepts anymore—AI agents are now entering production, helping businesses automate workflows, optimize decisions, and reduce operational costs.

One of the biggest shifts we’re seeing is the movement toward smaller, discipline-specific AI models that offer greater accuracy and efficiency. Instead of massive, general-purpose AI models, businesses are opting for targeted solutions that drive real-world impact.

Watch the full episode here:to explore the cutting-edge AI trends defining 2025!
postsData.commentAdded: Exciting insights from Brad Messer! The shift to specialized AI models is a game-changer for efficiency and impact in 2025. 🚀 #AIFuture

postsData.name:
Alex Turnbull
Alex Turnbull
postsData.content:
In 2023, software platforms died. In 2025, software portfolios ate them.

Mass Market Era (2015-2023):

- Massive platforms were standard, it was all about "scale at all costs"
- Product development through huge engineering teams
- Headcount over efficiency in team building
- Traditional VC funding faced little scrutiny despite burn rates
- Software seen as a winner-take-all market
- More engineers meant more features meant more market share
- Growth hacking and blitzscaling dominated tactics
- Every business needs a unicorn dream!

The New World of Software: AI Holdcos (2025-????):

- The old playbook delivers less than 10% of past capital efficiency
- Small teams lead through vertical focus that compounds
- Deep specialization over time directly with market
- AI-powered development captures customers at the right moment
- 5-person teams handle more output with higher quality
- Development cycles compress by 90% through AI acceleration
- Culture thrives as bootstrapped companies eliminate politics
- Platform plays give way to portfolio thinking as the dominant model

As the retail transformation showed us:

"We are experiencing a specialty store revolution."

This is a complete re-ordering of the software playbook.

It's going to be difficult for many to navigate ("but... I don't want to give up my unicorn dreams!" cries the VC). The answer is: build small, stack verticals, and let AI be your leverage.

There's no going back.

The only way out is through.

And in 2025, the holdco builder wins. This is the Micro-Machine Era

comments.commentText:
Indeed, small teams (as few as five people) can now outperform large engineering departments. U nailed it, Alex.

Basically, AI is driving shorter dev cycles with higher quality results.
I spent 30 years in SaaS (Fintech). The emerging game is definitely the stacking of multiple specialized products now.

In fact, I expect the best of these GPT "wrappers" to start showing up in "greatest hits" packs as bolt-ons. Think Microsoft "Office" back in the day...

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting insights! Embracing specialization and AI will redefine success in the software industry. Heres to thriving in the Micro-Machine Era! 🚀

postsData.name:
Neil Sarkar
Neil Sarkar
postsData.content:
Manufacturing sales is getting hacked  and you might be the last to know

Ever feel like your RFQs vanish into a black hole? Or that your sales cycle moves slower than a fax machine stuck in 1998?
Meanwhile, your competitors are out there closing deals before you even get past “Just following up…”. How? Because manufacturing sales isn’t just evolving—it’s getting a full-blown tech makeover️.

Here’s how tech is rewriting the sales playbook (and why your competitors are secretly laughing at you):

1️⃣ Dynamic Pricing is Killing ‘Let Me Get Back to You’ Quotes
Remember when pricing was simple? Yeah, neither do I. AI-driven dynamic pricing now adjusts in real-time based on demand, material costs, and competitor moves. Buyers get instant, data-backed quotes. Reps stop fumbling with spreadsheets. More closed deals, less “waiting on approvals.

2️⃣ Industrial Marketplaces Are Making Cold Outreach Obsolete
Buyers are shopping for machines like they shop for sneakers—scrolling through industrial marketplaces like Xometry and Alibaba. If your company isn’t optimized for digital discovery, you’re losing deals before your sales team even gets a chance.

3️⃣ Augmented Reality (AR) is Replacing Factory Visits
Why spend thousands flying a prospect in when AR can drop them inside your factory from their laptop? Customers can see real-time simulations of your machines in their workspace, eliminating objections and speeding up the sales cycle. No more ‘Let me think about it’—they’ve already seen it in action.

4️⃣ Digital Twins Are Doing the Selling for You
No more “Trust me, it’ll work.” Instead, sales teams are using digital twins—real-time, 3D replicas of a customer’s factory—showing exactly how your product fits in. Prospects see the ROI before they buy, and your sales team skips weeks of back-and-forth.

5️⃣ No More ‘Who Do I Call?’—AI Agents Are Fixing Salesforce Chaos
Managing hundreds of leads, RFQs, and follow-ups? AI-powered sales agents prioritize the hottest deals, automate outreach, and remind reps exactly who to call, when, and what to say. (Because let's be honest—Excel isn’t cutting it anymore.)

6️⃣ Your Website is Now Your Best Salesperson
Old-school manufacturers treat their websites like a business card. Modern manufacturers treat it like a 24/7 sales rep. High-performing B2B sites now offer instant quotes, interactive product demos, and automated lead qualification—because buyers don’t want to wait for a rep to respond.

The Bottom Line?
Manufacturing sales is no longer about who has the best cold call game. It’s about who sells smarter, faster, and with less friction 

Our AI agents are helping manufacturers stay ahead, but we know every team tackles this challenge differently. How do you keep your salesforce sharp and responsive?
Drop your thoughts in the comments—I’d love to hear what’s working for you!
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing tech like AI and AR is essential in todays sales landscape. Excited to see how others are adapting! 🚀

postsData.name:
Margaret Williams, ACC, MS
Margaret Williams, ACC, MS
postsData.content:
Master the art of the Strategic No!

Your availability doesn't measure your success.

Every high achiever I've coached said, ‘ 'I know I should say no more often... But what if they think I'm not committed? What if I miss something important?'

Let me share a secret that transformed my most successful clients.

The most respected professionals aren't the ones who say yes to everything.
They're the ones who master the art of the Strategic No.

Instead of saying, 'Sorry, I can't.'
 Try saying, 'I can prioritize this next sprint if we adjust Project X.'

Instead of saying, 'I'm too busy.'
 You could say, 'To give this the attention it deserves, I can start on it next week.

The results speak for themselves.

Leaders who set clear boundaries are 33% more likely to advance in their careers (Harvard Business Review, 2021).

The impact isn't about being everywhere but being present where you choose to be.

What deserves your energy today?

comments.commentText: True Margaret Williams, ACC, MS . Make your presence feel where you choose to be. Creating boundaries is important in leadership and throughout.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Setting boundaries is key to sustainable success. Prioritizing wisely can lead to impactful results. Thanks for sharing this insight!

postsData.name:
Devan Bhalla
Devan Bhalla
postsData.content:
She is a an Army doctor, a COVID warrior and the second woman from Sikkim to join the Indian Army as a Captain. Read the story of this inspiring personality here  

Born in Gangtok, to Rajendra Kumar Chettri & Bindu Chettri, Deepsikha, Deepsikha was always determined to serve the community.

She completed her schooling at Tashi Namgyal Academy, St Joseph’s Kalimpong and Birla Balika Vidyapeeth Pilani.

She went on to pursue a career in medicine by enrolling in the MBBS course at Sikkim Manipal Institute Of Medical Science and then went on to pursue her internship from Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital(PGIMER).

She secured the 6th in All-India ranking and 2nd among female candidates in the army medical exams.

While reading her interview, I came across the following quote which was indeed inspiring:

“Since childhood, I moulded my life in a way to be able to join the forces someday." she told to a leading daily.

She credited her success to her father with a brilliant quote,

"My father, Rajendra Kumar Chettri, is a well known name in Sikkim football and now in badminton.

Being a sportsman, he ensured that I stayed fit and disciplined all throughout my life.

He saw that spark in me before I saw it in myself. He has always trusted me more than society,"

More power to this doctor who is working round the clock to serve the country.

Jai Hind.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Followfor your brand x business content.
(Hit theicon on my profile for the latest updates)

comments.commentText: Incredible feats come from a strong support system like her father provided

Chahat Exactly! A strong support system can make all the difference in achieving incredible feats. Her father’s encouragement and belief in her potential undoubtedly played a vital role in her journey.

postsData.commentAdded: Inspiring story! Deepsikha’s dedication and resilience highlight the incredible impact of service. Proud to see strong women leading in the army! 🌟💪 #JaiHind

postsData.name:
Gautam Grover
Gautam Grover
postsData.content:
Is Launching a Book Enough? 

Well, this answer comes with a lot of opinions.

For me, launching a book feels like the second step.

The first step is writing it! 

But here’s the catch: The most crucial steps come after,

The marketing and how positively you can inspire people to read it and believe in its message.

Your book isn’t just about the launch day; it’s about building a connection with your readers, making an impact, and ensuring your words resonate long after they've closed the final page.

So, for all aspiring authors: don’t just write and launch, create a movement around your book. That’s where the magic happens!

What’s your take? Let’s discuss in the comments!

P.S. My book is exclusively available in the World Book fair till 9th feb. Global Online Launch On 11th Feb. ️

comments.commentText: Marketing and community engagement can significantly amplify the impact of your work, transforming it from a simple book into a movement,

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agreed! Its all about building a community and lasting impact. Excited for your global launch—lets create that movement together! 📚✨
